items.sentence: That\'s not the way my grandmother made stuffing.
It\'s better to feed wild ducks grain than bread.
I think that you just answered your own question.
Tom is thirty years old, but he looks much older.
Tom is unlikely to be as busy as you think he is.
Tom is usually a little irritable in the morning.
Tom is very good at imitating the way Mary talks.
Tom and Mary went shopping together last weekend.
Tom came home from work earlier than usual today.
Tom felt that he was destined for greater things.
I looked for you everywhere and didn\'t find you.
I lost the door key, so I can\'t enter the house.
You\'re personally responsible for Tom\'s safety.
You\'re something of a troublemaker, aren\'t you?
You\'re still living on Park Street, aren\'t you?
Tom is just not the person that I thought he was.
Tom is lonely because he has no one to play with.
Tom is moving to Boston at the end of this month.
Tom is no better at remembering things than I am.
Tom is old enough to do that on his own, I think.
